meanings.definition: A person who selects or chooses
meanings.sent1: The cullers carefully picked the ripe fruits from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The cullers were responsible for choosing the best flowers for the bouquet.
meanings.sent3: The cullers had a tough job deciding which puppies to adopt from the shelter.
meanings.sent4: She was like a skilled culler, selecting the perfect words for her poem.
meanings.sent5: The cullers, with their keen eyes, spotted the hidden treasure among the rocks.

meanings.definition: To pick out or select from a group
meanings.sent1: He will cullers the best apples from the basket for the pie.
meanings.sent2: The farmer cullers the ripe vegetables from the garden every morning.
meanings.sent3: She decided to cullers the most colorful candies from the jar.
meanings.sent4: The detective had to cullers the important clues from the evidence.
meanings.sent5: The chef will cullers the freshest ingredients for tonight's special dish.

meanings.definition: The act of choosing or selecting from a group
meanings.sent1: The cullers of the team were responsible for selecting the best players for the match.
meanings.sent2: The cullers at the market carefully sorted through the produce to find the best ones.
meanings.sent3: The cullers at the fashion show had a tough time deciding on the winning design.
meanings.sent4: In the library, the cullers of books had to make tough decisions on which ones to keep.
meanings.sent5: The cullers of the jury had to deliberate and choose the most suitable verdict.
